thread.title: Take That's Howard Donald welcomes son Dougie Bear | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Take That's Howard Donald welcomes son Dougie Bear | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Freeth For Mailonline
title: Take That's Howard Donald welcomes son Dougie Bear | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 246 shares The arrival of his Howard's bundle of joy therefore casts doubt over the forthcoming Let It Shine final this weekend as he spends time with his precious newborn. Bandmate Gary had staged a Take That reunion with former member Robbie Williams and current member Mark Owen for the series finale of the BBC talent show. Delighted: Howard announced the arrival of his fourth child via Twitter on Wednesday morning In labour: Howard (here last week) is said to have skipped the Gala night of Gary Barlow's The Girls Musical after his wife went into labour Throwing it into chaos: It was reported on Tuesday night that Howard (left) skipped the Gala night of bandmate Gary Barlow's (centre, here with third Take That member Mark Owen, last week) The Girls Musical Take That singer Howard announced that he and Katie were expecting their second child together back in October. The Twitter announcement came just 10 months after welcoming their son Bowie in January 2016. The 48-year-old said he was thrilled with the news - though not looking forward to more sleepless nights. Singing superstar: The musician already has two daughters from previous relationships Guess what: The couple announced the happy news that they were expecting another child, back in October, just 10 months after their first was born He tweeted: 'Guess what? Me and katie are happy to announce we will have our 2nd child in Feb. Yay! No more sleep for another 2 years! (sic)' Howard already has two daughters, Grace (born 1999) and Lola (born 2005), from two previous relationships. Grace's mother is Victoria Piddington, while Marie-Christine Musswessels, who he split from in late 2009, is the mother of his second child. Famous face: Howard (centre) has been with Take That bandmates Gary Barlow (left) and Mark Owen (right, here in February) for over 20 years His first son was named in honour of iconic singer David Bowie, who had died of cancer just two days before the baby was born. He tweeted at the time: 'Bowie Taylan Donald came into this world on Tues 12th Jan. Mummy and daddy suffering sleep deprivation but life is wonderful, he is divine.' Earlier that week, the Never Forget hitmaker had paid tribute to 'genius' singer David and recalled the time he and former bandmate Jason Orange met the 'Moonage Daydream' hitmaker. He tweeted: 'Feel very honoured that I have a photo of me and jay with David Bowie. When we did TOTP. What a genius and a great loss. RIP.(sic)' Howard and Katie were married in January 2015 in a secret two-day wedding. Expecting, again: The duo (here in January 2015) started a family in February 2016 with the arrival of baby Bowie The couple met while Take That were filming Marks & Spencer Christmas TV advert in 2008, but only started dating in 2010. In August 2015, Howard took to Twitter to share the news that he and Katie were starting a family. The Take That singer wrote: 'I have some amazing news to share with you all Katie and I are having a baby! Over the moon: Howard said he couldn't wait to expand the family 'So proud of my beautiful wife and can't wait for the newest member of our family to arrive.' Howard first met Katie when the band filmed a Marks & Spencer Christmas TV advert in 2008 but it was two years before they started dating. Howard and Katie surprised fans with a secret two-day wedding extravaganza in January. Exciting news: Howard first met Katie, pictured together on holiday in 2010, when the band filmed a Marks & Spencer Christmas TV advert in 2008 but it was two years before they started dating A spokesperson for the singer told MailOnline: 'I can confirm Howard Donald and Katie Halil were married at a private ceremony for close family and friends on January 2.' Friends were thrilled for the pair, with the singer and his illustrator wife saying their vows at an intimate marriage ceremony attended by close friends and family. A source told the Daily Mirror newspaper: 'Everyone is so chuffed for Howard and Katie: they make a gorgeous couple.' The following day they held a huge celebration at Aynhoe Park, a stately home in the Cotswolds, Oxfordshire. Guests - including his fellow bandmates, Mark and Gary, as well as ex-Take That member Jason Orange - enjoyed champagne, pizza and fish and chips at the posh venue. The source shared : 'Jason and Howard have always been the very best of friends and extremely tight. It was like the old days again being together.' Howard wore a dark purple dinner suit to the party and the celebrations continued late into the night. A guest said: 'Howard looked extremely happy with his bride Katie at his side amongst their guests. There were about 140 people there â€“ it was a kicking do until at least 1.30am.' What a year! Howard and Katie surprised fans with a secret two-day wedding extravaganza in January 2015 Share or comment on this article 246
